original: n+ya gro dha'i 'ba' zhig gi'o //
analyzed: n+ya gro dha'i 'ba' zhig gi'o //
translated: [The word] nyagrodha [means] 'only fig tree'.

original: phan tshun byed pa la ma yin no //
analyzed: phan tshun byed pa la ma yin no //
translated: [The word] anyonya [means] 'reciprocally'.

original: sv'a gtal sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: sv'a gtal sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: [The word] svagata [means] 'welcome'.

original: shva dang po'i ain la'o //
analyzed: shva dang po'i ain la'o //
translated: [The word] śva [means] 'first'.

original: pa da'i yang na'o //
analyzed: pa da'i yang na'o //
translated: [The word] pada [means] 'again'.

original: phyi ma'i tshig gi'o //
analyzed: phyi ma'i tshig gi'o //
translated: [The word] paścāt [means] 'of the latter word'.

original: cha shas las dus kyi'o //
analyzed: cha shas las dus kyi'o //
translated: [The word] bhāga [means] 'of time'.

original: su sarba ; aarda las ljongs kyi'o //
analyzed: su sarba ; aarda las ljongs kyi'o //
translated: [The word] sarva [means] 'of the country'.

original: phyogs las ma drang ma yin pa'i'o //
analyzed: phyogs las ma drang ma yin pa'i'o //
translated: [The word] dik [means] 'not straight'.

original: sam khy'a las grangs dang la dang yongs su 'jal ba la ste /
analyzed: sam khy'a las grangs dang la dang yongs su 'jal ba la ste /
translated: [The word] saṃkhyā [means] 'number, measure, and calculation'.

original: ming dang sh'a na /
analyzed: ming dang sh'a na /
translated: [The word] nāma [means] 'name'.

original: ku la dza ma yin pa'i'o //
analyzed: ku la dza ma yin pa'i'o //
translated: [The word] kula [means] 'not born'.

original: padsha'i 'byung ba ma yin pa la'o //
analyzed: padsha'i 'byung ba ma yin pa la'o //
translated: [The word] padśa [means] 'not an element'.

original: proshtha dang bha dra dag las ba da'i rigs la'o //
analyzed: proshtha dang bha dra dag las ba da'i rigs la'o //
translated: [The word] proṣṭha [means] 'of the family of Bhadra'.

original: hrid: bha ga: sindhu'i gnyis ka'i'o //🔽aa nu sha ti ka @185b sogs rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: hrid: bha ga: sindhu'i gnyis ka'i'o // aa nu sha ti ka @185b sogs rnams kyi'o //
translated: [The word] hṛdaya [means] 'of both the Sindhus'.

original: shar gyi grong khyer rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: shar gyi grong khyer rnams kyi'o //
translated: [The word] anuśāsana [means] 'of the eastern cities'.

original: dang gi don la lha rnams kyi s'ukta ha bi sha dag la'o //
analyzed: dang gi don la lha rnams kyi s'ukta ha bi sha dag la'o //
translated: [The word] saha [means] 'of the gods'.

original: aindra'i phyi ma'i ma yin no //
analyzed: aindra'i phyi ma'i ma yin no //
translated: [The word] indra [means] 'not the latter'.

original: ring po las ba ru ni'i'o //
analyzed: ring po las ba ru ni'i'o //
translated: [The word] dīrgha [means] 'of Varuna'.

original: dzi ga la dhe nu: ba la dza'i ches gzhan pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: dzi ga la dhe nu: ba la dza'i ches gzhan pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: The rest of the words are formed from the root jigati with the affix jhal.

original: aardha las aa na ta /🔽yongs su 'jal de'i ni'o //
analyzed: aardha las aa na ta / yongs su 'jal de'i ni'o //
translated: From the root ardha, the word ananta is formed.🔽The word parimandala is formed from the root parimandala.

original: pra las ba ha na'i bha ka las der yang ngo //
analyzed: pra las ba ha na'i bha ka las der yang ngo //
translated: The word bahubhadra is formed from the root pra.

original: nanya las shu tsi a'i shva ra: kshe tre dznya: ku sha la: ni bu na: rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: nanya las shu tsi a'i shva ra: kshe tre dznya: ku sha la: ni bu na: rnams kyi'o //
translated: The words śucisattvacakṣuḥkṣetrajñaḥ kuśalinibandhu are formed from the root ny.

original: mri dzi las so //
analyzed: mri dzi las so //
translated: The word mṛj is formed from the root mṛj.

original: k'i ta la aa tsa la yang na'o //
analyzed: k'i ta la aa tsa la yang na'o //
translated: The word acala is formed from the root kīta.

original: gnyis ma yin pa las aut kyi 'jig pa la ha la ting la'o //
analyzed: gnyis ma yin pa las aut kyi 'jig pa la ha la ting la'o //
translated: The word haladini is formed from the root utaka with the affix ṇini.

original: a'urn'u'i yang na'o //
analyzed: a'urn'u'i yang na'o //
translated: The word ūrṇā is formed from the root ūrṇu.

original: aa la la ma yin no //
analyzed: aa la la ma yin no //
translated: The word alaka is formed from the root ala.

original: sitsa la aa shva ba rasmee'i tshig go //
analyzed: sitsa la aa shva ba rasmee'i tshig go //
translated: The word aśvavarṣmī is formed from the root siñc.

original: hel las aa tsa'i'o //🔽ait la ma yin no //
analyzed: hel las aa tsa'i'o // ait la ma yin no //
translated: The word acchī is formed from the root hel.🔽The word anīti is formed from the root īt.

original: a'urnu las yang na'o //
analyzed: a'urnu las yang na'o //
translated: The word ūrṇā is formed from the root ūrṇu.

original: pa la sogs mtha' nye'i a'at kyi shva sa ksha na hm++ya ae ngit min pa las so //
analyzed: pa la sogs mtha' nye'i a'at kyi shva sa ksha na hm++ya ae ngit min pa las so //
translated: The word śvaḥsākṣāt is formed from the root āt with the affix ṇini.

original: ba da bra dza ra la mtha'i'o //🔽nynit la han gyi ta ste tsin nal min pa la'o //
analyzed: ba da bra dza ra la mtha'i'o // nynit la han gyi ta ste tsin nal min pa la'o //
translated: The word vadatprajñā is formed from the root vad.🔽The word hanta is formed from the root nyā.

original: a'at las nal ma yin pa la yuka'o //
analyzed: a'at las nal ma yin pa la yuka'o //
translated: The word yuk is formed from the root āt with the affix ṇini.

original: dza ni ba dhi dang ka mi a'atsa mi ba mi aa mi shram min pa'i ait dang bcas pa'i ma'i ma yin no //🔽au pa ra ma las ghanya la'o //
analyzed: dza ni ba dhi dang ka mi a'atsa mi ba mi aa mi shram min pa'i ait dang bcas pa'i ma'i ma yin no // au pa ra ma las ghanya la'o //
translated: Ja is the affix of the present tense, except in the case of bad, kam, ac, vam, am, and śram.🔽The affix ṇa is added to the root ghu by uparāma.

original: aud las kyang yam las so //
analyzed: aud las kyang yam las so //
translated: The affix ya is added to the root ud.

original: ri: hr'i: tsli: r'i: kshu: y'i: kshmay'i: a'at rnams kyi ni la buka'o //
analyzed: ri: hr'i: tsli: r'i: kshu: y'i: kshmay'i: a'at rnams kyi ni la buka'o //
translated: The affix la is added to the roots ri, hri, cli, ri, kṣu, yā, kṣam, and āt.

original: b'a las g-yo ba la dzuka'o //🔽dh'unya pr'inya dag las nuka'o //
analyzed: b'a las g-yo ba la dzuka'o // dh'unya pr'inya dag las nuka'o //
translated: The affix ju is added to the root vā by the affix juk.🔽The affix nuk is added to the roots dhūnya and prīṇya.

original: aa n'a tve l'i las: snum pa dang gsher bar byed pa la yang na'o //🔽l'a las luka'o //🔽p'a ti'i'o // sbyor ba po las 'jig pa li bha las shuka'o //
analyzed: aa n'a tve l'i las: snum pa dang gsher bar byed pa la yang na'o // l'a las luka'o // p'a ti'i'o // sbyor ba po las 'jig pa li bha las shuka'o //
translated: The affix na is added to the root anātvī by the affix ṇam.🔽The affix luk is added to the root la.🔽The affix śuk is added to the root vibha by the affix li.

original: sph'a ya'i wa'o //
analyzed: sph'a ya'i wa'o //
translated: The affix va is added to the root sphā.

original: sha di'i 'gro ba ma yin pa la ta'o //
analyzed: sha di'i 'gro ba ma yin pa la ta'o //
translated: The affix ta is added to the root śad by the affix aṇ.

original: ru ta las pu la yang na'o //
analyzed: ru ta las pu la yang na'o //
translated: The affix pu is added to the root rud by the affix ya.

original: se tya: aartha kr'i da: li kha: banta: be da rnams kyi a'a buka'o //
analyzed: se tya: aartha kr'i da: li kha: banta: be da rnams kyi a'a buka'o //
translated: The affix abuk is added to the roots set, arthakṛt, likha, vanta, and veda.

original: dza n'i: dzr'i sha kna su: ranydza mi dam rnams kyi thung ngu'o //
analyzed: dza n'i: dzr'i sha kna su: ranydza mi dam rnams kyi thung ngu'o //
translated: The short vowel is added to the roots jani, jṛṣ, kan, and rñja by the affix su.

original: ai di tsa li: la di svan dhvan: smri dr'i: nr'i shr'a rnams a'urdzdzan kam pa ni dzi hvanmanthan /
analyzed: ai di tsa li: la di svan dhvan: smri dr'i: nr'i shr'a rnams a'urdzdzan kam pa ni dzi hvanmanthan /
translated: idācārya, laghuvṛtti, smṛti, nṛśarīra, aujjvalakampanajihvāmanthāna,

original: aa ba dhvam san shabda a'a dhy'a na: bha ya: na ya @186a * //🔽p'a ka rnams la'o //
analyzed: aa ba dhvam san shabda a'a dhy'a na: bha ya: na ya @186a * // p'a ka rnams la'o //
translated: avadhūtasvarādhyāya, bhaya, nayapāka.

original: ma da las dga' ba dang gle pa na dag la'o //
analyzed: ma da las dga' ba dang gle pa na dag la'o //
translated: madācārya, madalekha.

original: gla sna: pa na: ba ma: dzva: la hma la: na ma las nyer bsgyur med pa las yang na'o //
analyzed: gla sna: pa na: ba ma: dzva: la hma la: na ma las nyer bsgyur med pa las yang na'o //
translated: laṅkācārya, vāmacandra, jvālā, laghuvṛtti, nāma.

original: k'a sha pha na las so //
analyzed: k'a sha pha na las so //
translated: kāśyapācārya.

original: ka mi ai ma tsam rnams kyi ma yin no //🔽sha ma: ya ma las lta ba dang yongs su 'jug pa dag la'o //
analyzed: ka mi ai ma tsam rnams kyi ma yin no // sha ma: ya ma las lta ba dang yongs su 'jug pa dag la'o //
translated: kamalācārya, na.🔽śākyamācārya, yama.

original: skha di las aa pa pa ri dag las so //
analyzed: skha di las aa pa pa ri dag las so //
translated: sakṛdācārya, aparāntaka.

original: tsi na nam dag gi yang na'o //
analyzed: tsi na nam dag gi yang na'o //
translated: cinanācārya.

original: dakshi: kshanydz'i: kandi: krandi rnams kyi ring po'o //
analyzed: dakshi: kshanydz'i: kandi: krandi rnams kyi ring po'o //
translated: dakṣiṇācārya, kṣaṇikācārya, kaṇḍikācārya, krandicārya.

original: ai di las gha'o //
analyzed: ai di las gha'o //
translated: idācārya.

original: gcig la nyer bsgyur la'o //
analyzed: gcig la nyer bsgyur la'o //
translated: ekācārya.

original: ais: man: tran: kvi rnams la'o //
analyzed: ais: man: tran: kvi rnams la'o //
translated: iṣṭanācārya, trāṇacārya, kavi.

original: kha tsa la'o //
analyzed: kha tsa la'o //
translated: khacārya.

original: hm'ad  las nishtha ktin dag go //
analyzed: hm'ad  las nishtha ktin dag go //
translated: haṃsācārya, niṣṭhakāntaka.

original: tsad la mtha' nye'i 'o //
analyzed: tsad la mtha' nye'i 'o //
translated: The affix ṇini is added to the root kṣa.

original: aak phyis pa dang sh'a su ri dita rnams kyi ma yin no //
analyzed: aak phyis pa dang sh'a su ri dita rnams kyi ma yin no //
translated: The affix ṇini is not added to the roots kṣa, śa, and śrī.

original: bhr'a dza bh'a sa: bh'a sha: d'a pa: dz'i ba m'i la: d'i da ka nar na ba na hirba yub shra na ma ha rnams kyi yang na'o //
analyzed: bhr'a dza bh'a sa: bh'a sha: d'a pa: dz'i ba m'i la: d'i da ka nar na ba na hirba yub shra na ma ha rnams kyi yang na'o //
translated: The affix ṇini is added to the roots bhrāj, bhāṣ, dāpa, jīvam, dīpaka, and vanah.

original: ri'i rita'o // ghr'i ra a'i ta'o //🔽sth'a'i 'o // pi bati las ta 'di'i b'i ba la yuka'o //
analyzed: ri'i rita'o // ghr'i ra a'i ta'o // sth'a'i 'o // pi bati las ta 'di'i b'i ba la yuka'o //
translated: The affix ṇini is added to the roots ri, riti, and gharī.🔽The affix ṇini is added to the roots sthā, sthiti, and pi.

original: deng gi lit la di gi'o //
analyzed: deng gi lit la di gi'o //
translated: The affix ṇini is added to the root lita.

original: sup  ma yin pa las byings ma yin pa'i sngon ma'i aata kyi aita ka a'ab la'o //
analyzed: sup  ma yin pa las byings ma yin pa'i sngon ma'i aata kyi aita ka a'ab la'o //
translated: The affix ṇini is added to the root as before the affix ṇini.

original: ya ka dag las tya sya ma yin pa'i a'ap kyi yang na'o //
analyzed: ya ka dag las tya sya ma yin pa'i a'ap kyi yang na'o //
translated: The affix ṇini is added to the roots yā and ka.

original: bhastra: ae sh'a aa dz'a: dzny'a: dv'a: sv'a rnams kyi bsdu ba la 'ang ngo //
analyzed: bhastra: ae sh'a aa dz'a: dzny'a: dv'a: sv'a rnams kyi bsdu ba la 'ang ngo //
translated: The affix ṇini is added to the roots bhasta, ṛṣi, ājñā, jña, dvā, and svār.

original: ma brjod pa'i skyes pa can a'ata'ang ngo //
analyzed: ma brjod pa'i skyes pa can a'ata'ang ngo //
translated: The affix ṇini is added to the roots that do not have a final vowel.

original: bartta ka: bya la'o //🔽s'u ta k'a: pu tra k'a: prinda ra ka rnams so //
analyzed: bartta ka: bya la'o // s'u ta k'a: pu tra k'a: prinda ra ka rnams so //
translated: The affix ṇini is added to the root varttaka.

original: na ri k'a'o //
analyzed: na ri k'a'o //
translated: The affix ṇini is added to the roots sūtaka, puttaka, and pṛṅkṛ.🔽The affix ṇini is added to the root nṛ.

original: k'i la ka la sogs pa rnams dang yata tang dag gi ma yin no //
analyzed: k'i la ka la sogs pa rnams dang yata tang dag gi ma yin no //
translated: not with kālaka, etc., nor with yata, etc.

original: smon pa la'o //
analyzed: smon pa la'o //
translated: [It is used] with the optative.

original: t'a ra k'a: barna ka dag skar ma dang srad bu dag la'o //
analyzed: t'a ra k'a: barna ka dag skar ma dang srad bu dag la'o //
translated: [It is used] with tārakāḥ, 'stars,' and sūnā, 'thread.'

original: aashta k'a pha mes rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: aashta k'a pha mes rnams kyi'o //
translated: [It is used] with aṣṭakā, 'the eighth day of the fortnight.'

original: ghi ta n+yata dag gi tsa dza dag gi ku'o //
analyzed: ghi ta n+yata dag gi tsa dza dag gi ku'o //
translated: [It is used] with gītā, 'song,' and nyāca, 'to give.'

original: n+yad ku la sogs pa rnams so //🔽nynita na rnams la ha na'i hi la'o //
analyzed: n+yad ku la sogs pa rnams so // nynita na rnams la ha na'i hi la'o //
translated: [It is used] with nyāca, 'to give,' etc.🔽[It is used] with nyāyata, 'in a proper way,' etc.

original: gnyis nyid kyi rgyu la'o //
analyzed: gnyis nyid kyi rgyu la'o //
translated: [It is used] with dvaya, 'two,' and hetu, 'cause.'

original: hi'i tsad ma yin bal 'o //
analyzed: hi'i tsad ma yin bal 'o //
translated: [It is used] with hīcā, 'not being.'

original: sam lit dag la dzi'i 'o //
analyzed: sam lit dag la dzi'i 'o //
translated: [It is used] with saṃlīna, 'hidden.'

original: tsi'i yang na'o //
analyzed: tsi'i yang na'o //
translated: [It is used] with ci, 'if.'

original: kla dang pa aas dzi phra dzi rnams kyi ma yin no //
analyzed: kla dang pa aas dzi phra dzi rnams kyi ma yin no //
translated: [It is used] with kṛ, 'to do,' and pā, 'to protect,' but not with prajñā, 'wisdom.'

original: aanydzi las 'gro ba la'o //
analyzed: aanydzi las 'gro ba la'o //
translated: [It is used] with aṇj, 'to go.'

original: nya la gdon mi za ba la'o //
analyzed: nya la gdon mi za ba la'o //
translated: [It is used] with nyā, 'to be sure.'

original: @186b ritsa: rutsa: yatsa: tya dza rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: @186b ritsa: rutsa: yatsa: tya dza rnams kyi'o //
translated: [It is used] with ric, 'to choose,' ruci, 'to like,' yaci, 'to ask,' and tyaja, 'to abandon.'

original: da tsa'i sgra dang ming ma yin pa la'o //
analyzed: da tsa'i sgra dang ming ma yin pa la'o //
translated: [It is used] with da, 'to give,' and cā, 'to take,' but not with śabda, 'sound,' and nāma, 'name.'

original: pra yo dzyani yo dzya dag nus pa la'o //
analyzed: pra yo dzyani yo dzya dag nus pa la'o //
translated: [It is used] with prayojana, 'purpose,' and yojana, 'to join.'

original: bho dzyam za ba la'o //
analyzed: bho dzyam za ba la'o //
translated: [It is used] with bhojana, 'food.'

original: pra y'a dza: aa nu y'a dza dag mchod sbyin gyi yan lag la'o //
analyzed: pra y'a dza: aa nu y'a dza dag mchod sbyin gyi yan lag la'o //
translated: [It is used] with prayāga, 'sacrifice,' and anu-yāga, 'to sacrifice.'

original: bhu dza lag pa la'o //
analyzed: bhu dza lag pa la'o //
translated: Bhuja is for hand.

original: shyan la aota kyi dbyi'o //
analyzed: shyan la aota kyi dbyi'o //
translated: Shyana is for the head of a lion.

original: ksa'i aa tsa la'o //
analyzed: ksa'i aa tsa la'o //
translated: Kasa is for aśani.

original: du ha: di ha li ha: gu ha las tad so byang la yang na 'jig go //
analyzed: du ha: di ha li ha: gu ha las tad so byang la yang na 'jig go //
translated: Duḥ, di, li, hu, and gu are for the twenty-eight lunar mansions.

original: sha mi ta mi: da mi: shra mi: shra mi: bhra mi: kla mi: mi da: ksha ma rnams kyi ring po'o //
analyzed: sha mi ta mi: da mi: shra mi: shra mi: bhra mi: kla mi: mi da: ksha ma rnams kyi ring po'o //
translated: Śamitā, damitā, śramitā, śramī, bhramī, klāmī, midā, and kṣamā are for the long vowels.

original: shthi: bu kl'a: mu: a'a: tsa ma rnams kyi shita la'o //
analyzed: shthi: bu kl'a: mu: a'a: tsa ma rnams kyi shita la'o //
translated: Sthiti, bu, kala, mu, ā, and ca are for the short vowels.

original: kram las pa rasmee'i tshig go //
analyzed: kram las pa rasmee'i tshig go //
translated: Krama is for the word parasmai.

original: ai shu ga mi yam rnams kyi che'o //
analyzed: ai shu ga mi yam rnams kyi che'o //
translated: Iṣu, gami, and yam are for the long vowels.

original: pra: ghr'a: dhm'a: sth'a: ma: d'a na: dri sha: aarti: sha da: sa ta rnams kyi bi wa: dzi ghra dha ma: tishtha: ma na: yatstshe: ba shya sh'i ya: s'i da rnams so //
analyzed: pra: ghr'a: dhm'a: sth'a: ma: d'a na: dri sha: aarti: sha da: sa ta rnams kyi bi wa: dzi ghra dha ma: tishtha: ma na: yatstshe: ba shya sh'i ya: s'i da rnams so //
translated: Pra, ghara, dhama, sthāna, ma, dāna, dṛśya, artha, śata, and sat are for the words viva, jighra, dhama, tistha, mana, yaccha, vaśya, śiṣya, and sādhu.

original: dzny'a dzan dag gi dz'a'o //
analyzed: dzny'a dzan dag gi dz'a'o //
translated: Jña and jana are for ja.

original: na ldan pa'i thung ngu'o //
analyzed: na ldan pa'i thung ngu'o //
translated: Na is for the short vowels.

original: zhes pa s'a dhu k'irtti'i 'jam dpal gyi sgra brda sprod pa las skabs brgyad pa'i rkang pa dang po rdzogs so /
analyzed: zhes pa s'a dhu k'irtti'i 'jam dpal gyi sgra brda sprod pa las skabs brgyad pa'i rkang pa dang po rdzogs so /
translated: Thus ends the first line of the eighth chapter of Mañjuśrī's Phonetics in the Sādhu Kirti.

original: // / mi di'i yon tan no //
analyzed: // / mi di'i yon tan no //
translated: The qualities of this man.

original: byings las so //
analyzed: byings las so //
translated: From the root.

original: dzus puka dag la'o //
analyzed: dzus puka dag la'o //
translated: In the case of jūṣa and puka.

original: yang ba mtha' nye'o //
analyzed: yang ba mtha' nye'o //
translated: The light one is near the end.

original: au shnu dag gi'o //
analyzed: au shnu dag gi'o //
translated: Of the two uṣṇas.

original: sri dza: dri sha dag gi dzhal la aam ste kita min pa la'o //
analyzed: sri dza: dri sha dag gi dzhal la aam ste kita min pa la'o //
translated: Of the two sṛja and dṛśa, the jha is in the case of kit.

original: spri sha: mri sha: hri sha: tri ba: pri ba: sri pa rnams kyi yang na'o //
analyzed: spri sha: mri sha: hri sha: tri ba: pri ba: sri pa rnams kyi yang na'o //
translated: Of the two spṛś, mṛś, hṛś, trī, prī, and sṛp, also the na.

original: su ga'i aatsa'i pita kun 'gro la min no //
analyzed: su ga'i aatsa'i pita kun 'gro la min no //
translated: Of su, the a is not in the case of the all-pervading.

original: dz'a gri las pi tsi na naya bita rnams la'o //
analyzed: dz'a gri las pi tsi na naya bita rnams la'o //
translated: From jāgri, the pi and ci are in the case of nayavita.

original: tri na ha'i aimba li'o //
analyzed: tri na ha'i aimba li'o //
translated: Of trīna and hī, the ai.

original: bhr'u las a'ita'o //🔽yang las yang na'o //🔽aasti sitsa las aala'i 'o //
analyzed: bhr'u las a'ita'o // yang las yang na'o // aasti sitsa las aala'i 'o //
translated: Of bhru, the ṛ.🔽Of ya, the ya.🔽Of asti and sita, the a.

original: rung rnams dang shva sri sva pi dzaksha rnams las aata 'ang ngo //
analyzed: rung rnams dang shva sri sva pi dzaksha rnams las aata 'ang ngo //
translated: Also the a is in the case of the suitable ones, śva, śrī, sva, and pī.

original: aad las so //
analyzed: aad las so //
translated: From ad.

original: yanya la aata kyi ring po'o //
analyzed: yanya la aata kyi ring po'o //
translated: In the case of yanya, the long a.

original: sub pa 'ang ngo //
analyzed: sub pa 'ang ngo //
translated: Also the u.

original: mang po rnams la dzha la la aee ta'o //
analyzed: mang po rnams la dzha la la aee ta'o //
translated: In the case of the many, the jha is in the case of la.

original: aos la 'ang ngo //
analyzed: aos la 'ang ngo //
translated: Also the o.

original: t'a la 'ang a'ab kyi ring po'i 'o //
analyzed: t'a la 'ang a'ab kyi ring po'i 'o //
translated: In the case of tā, the long ā.

original: sam budhi la'o //
analyzed: sam budhi la'o //
translated: In the case of sambuddha.

original: da la ka ma yin pa'i ma'i don dang na de rnams la thung ngu'o //
analyzed: da la ka ma yin pa'i ma'i don dang na de rnams la thung ngu'o //
translated: The meaning of the feminine is not like that. Those are the short ones.

original: bu la bsngags pa la m'a tra'i m'a ta'o //
analyzed: bu la bsngags pa la m'a tra'i m'a ta'o //
translated: In the praise of a son, there is mātaḥ and mātaḥ.

original: aita auta @187a * //
analyzed: aita auta @187a * //
translated: It and ut.

original: kyi yon tan no //🔽lug la yang na'o //
analyzed: kyi yon tan no // lug la yang na'o //

original: dzas la'ang ngo //🔽ngita la n'a t'a la min no //
analyzed: dzas la'ang ngo // ngita la n'a t'a la min no //
translated: In a sheep, there is also na.🔽In a son, there is also na.🔽In a goat, there is not nāta.

original: sa khi la sa ma yin no //
analyzed: sa khi la sa ma yin no //
translated: In a cow, there is not sama.

original: bsdu ba la yang na'o //
analyzed: bsdu ba la yang na'o //

original: pa ti las so //
analyzed: pa ti las so //
translated: From pati.

original: pud  med la t'a n'a min pa las so //
analyzed: pud  med la t'a n'a min pa las so //
translated: In a woman, there is not tā.

original: a'a nu dy'a'o //
analyzed: a'a nu dy'a'o //
translated: Anudaya.

original: a'a pa las y'ata'o //
analyzed: a'a pa las y'ata'o //
translated: From apa, there is yāt.

original: sarba n'as ma la sy'a auta'ang ngo //🔽t'i yi sarba n'a ma bzhin yang na'o //
analyzed: sarba n'as ma la sy'a auta'ang ngo // t'i yi sarba n'a ma bzhin yang na'o //
translated: From sarvan, there is malasyā.🔽From ti, there is sarvanamā.🔽From gi, there is ām and ni.

original: ngi'i a'am n'i dang ni d'i las so //
analyzed: ngi'i a'am n'i dang ni d'i las so //

original: a'ita las gtso bo ma yin pa'i bsdu ba la no a'ata aantu yang na'o //🔽aita auta dag gi aoota de aata kyang yon tan gyi'o //
analyzed: a'ita las gtso bo ma yin pa'i bsdu ba la no a'ata aantu yang na'o // aita auta dag gi aoota de aata kyang yon tan gyi'o //

original: rita las d'i shva dag gi yon tan no //
analyzed: rita las d'i shva dag gi yon tan no //

original: brtsegs pa dang po'i lita la kita la'o //
analyzed: brtsegs pa dang po'i lita la kita la'o //

original: skrinya las so //
analyzed: skrinya las so //

original: airta ritstsha ti r'ita rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: airta ritstsha ti r'ita rnams kyi'o //

analyzed: shrv'i: dr'i: pra: rnams kyi thung ngu yang na'o //

analyzed: ri dri sha'i aad la'o //

analyzed: shvi las aata'o // aa su: ba ta: ba tsa rnams kyi thug / bum: aum ma rnams so //

analyzed: sh'imnga las: kun 'gro la'o //

original: ya kdita la aa yang ngo //
analyzed: ya kdita la aa yang ngo //

analyzed: nyer bsgyur las a'u ha'i thung ngu'o //

analyzed: ling la a'i na'i'o //

analyzed: ka la ae ni'o //

analyzed: kapa la ma yin no //

analyzed: a'apa kyi yang na'o //

analyzed: krita min pa kun 'gro la ring po'o //

original: yang na tsvi la'o //
analyzed: yang na tsvi la'o //

original: r'ang rita las so //
analyzed: r'ang rita las so //

original: sha yako: y'a su ta la ring 'o //
analyzed: sha yako: y'a su ta la ring 'o //

analyzed: aarti dang brtsegs pa dang po dag gi yon tan no //

analyzed: yang na la'o // 'tshe ba la han gyi ghni'o //

original: ghr'a dhma dag gi m'i'o //
analyzed: ghr'a dhma dag gi m'i'o //

original: tsval aa 'a'o// kya  tsa la'o //
analyzed: tsval aa 'a'o// kya  tsa la'o //

analyzed: bkres pa la aa sha na'i ma yin no //

analyzed: dha na'i sred pa la'o //

original: au da ka'i mu da no'o //
analyzed: au da ka'i mu da no'o //

analyzed: zas la aa suka kyang ngo //

analyzed: ta la kita la dya ta sya ti m'a sth'a rnams aita'o //

analyzed: sh'a tstsh'a dag gi yang na'o //

original: da dh'a ti'i hi'o //
analyzed: da dh'a ti'i hi'o //

original: h'aka gi tv'a la'o //
analyzed: h'aka gi tv'a la'o //

analyzed: dhi dang d'a ngag gi ngata'o // nyer bsgyur gyi aatsa las ta'o //

analyzed: ao dzas aapsa @187b ras dag gi'o //

analyzed: mi: m'i: m'i dhi: ra bha: la bha: sha ka: pa ta: pa da rnams kyi aatsa san gyi sa la aisa'o //

analyzed: dandha'i a'ita'ang ngo //

original: ri dha'i ai ra'o //
analyzed: ri dha'i ai ra'o //

original: las med pa las mu tsi'i aota yang na'o //

original: hal dang po min pa'i'o //
analyzed: hal dang po min pa'i'o //

analyzed: ri'i aa ta'o //

analyzed: dang po'i aa ta hyi'o //

analyzed: bi sha pi dza ni dza rnams kyi shnu la yon tan no //

analyzed: ti ngas kyi'o //

original: kaska la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: kaska la sogs pa rnams so //

analyzed: ku las kyang rkyen bsgyur ba dang ba si ghas rnams kyi sa'i sha'o //

original: num dang rnam par bcad pa dang shar bar du chod pa la'ang ngo //
analyzed: num dang rnam par bcad pa dang shar bar du chod pa la'ang ngo //

original: stu dzi shan la'o //🔽ni las svi di sva ha las so //
analyzed: stu dzi shan la'o // ni las svi di sva ha las so //

original: nyer bsgyur gyi: su ne ti: su ba ti: sya ti: stoo ti: sto: bh'a ti: sva: se ni: sha: dha: si tse: sanydza: svanydza rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: nyer bsgyur gyi: su ne ti: su ba ti: sya ti: stoo ti: sto: bh'a ti: sva: se ni: sha: dha: si tse: sanydza: svanydza rnams kyi'o //

original: pra ti ma yin pa'i sad kyi'o //
analyzed: pra ti ma yin pa'i sad kyi'o //

original: stam bha las so //
analyzed: stam bha las so //

original: aa ba las bcom pa dang brten pa dang mi ring ba las so //
analyzed: aa ba las bcom pa dang brten pa dang mi ring ba las so //

original: bi las kyang sva na'i zas la'o //
analyzed: bi las kyang sva na'i zas la'o //

analyzed: pa ri: ni: bi las se ba: si ta: sa ya: si bu: sa hi: suta rnams @190a * //

analyzed: kyi'o // stu: svanydza: si ba la sogs pa rnams kyi aata bar na yod pa la yang na'o //

analyzed: bi las skanti las nashth'i min pa la yang na'o //

original: pa ri las so //
analyzed: pa ri las so //

analyzed: pa ri skanda: pr'a tsya bha ra ta rnams la'o //

analyzed: ni ra: aa bhi aa nu las kyang syanda las srog chags ma yin pa la'o //

analyzed: aagn'i sho ma dag go //

analyzed: dzyo ti ra: a'a yusha las kyang sto ma'i'o //

analyzed: pa tri dag las sva sri'i'o //

analyzed: mi 'jigs pa la yang ngo //

analyzed: su: bir: nir: dur rnams las sam: s'uti: su pa rnams kyi'o //

analyzed: nir: na d'i dag las: su dang bde ba: la'o //

analyzed: prashtha: sngon du 'gro ba'o //

analyzed: bi las str'i'i ming la'o //

analyzed: ga bi yu dhi las sth'i ri'o //

analyzed: ku min pa las aeta ming la'o //

analyzed: skar ma las aita las yang na'o // thung ngu las su pa kyi ta la'o //

translated: Of kula, having, and of ac, one, in the following word.

original: nyer bsgyur dang aantar las dur min pa las na nye bar bstan pa'i 'o //
analyzed: nyer bsgyur dang aantar las dur min pa las na nye bar bstan pa'i 'o //
translated: Of the indeclinables and of antarla, not dur, from.

original: he nu: m'in: a'a ni las so //
analyzed: he nu: m'in: a'a ni las so //
translated: Of hetu, min, and of ana, from.

original: ga da na da: pa ta: pa da ba pa ba ha: ha na: di ta: sha ma tsi: dhi m'a: b'a: y'a: dr'a: ps'a ti: sya ti rnams la ni las so //
analyzed: ga da na da: pa ta: pa da ba pa ba ha: ha na: di ta: sha ma tsi: dhi m'a: b'a: y'a: dr'a: ps'a ti: sya ti rnams la ni las so //
translated: Of gadana, pat, padava, pa, vaha, ha, dita, samcita, dhima, va, ya, dra, pasati, syati, from.

original: nye bar bstan pa la dang po ka kha dang mthar kha med pa la yang na'o //
analyzed: nye bar bstan pa la dang po ka kha dang mthar kha med pa la yang na'o //
translated: In the case of indeclinables, at the beginning ka, kha, and at the end, not kha, also.

original: aa na'i mtha' la yang ngo //
analyzed: aa na'i mtha' la yang ngo //
translated: Also at the end of ana.

original: niksha: nim sa: ninda rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: niksha: nim sa: ninda rnams kyi'o //
translated: Of nik, nim, and nida.

original: han gyi'o // aanti las so //
analyzed: han gyi'o // aanti las so //
translated: Of han, from anti.

original: sha las tshig la'o //
analyzed: sha las tshig la'o //
translated: Of sha, in the word.

original: shaka'i na shi'o tsu tu tu la shar dang / a'ang min pa'i tshig bar chod pa la'o //
analyzed: shaka'i na shi'o tsu tu tu la shar dang / a'ang min pa'i tshig bar chod pa la'o //
translated: Of shaka, in the case of shari, and of acut, in the case of interrupted words, not ang.

original: han gyi gha yis so //
analyzed: han gyi gha yis so //
translated: Of han, by gha.

original: ksha b+hna sogs rnams la'o //
analyzed: ksha b+hna sogs rnams la'o //
translated: kṣa, bhan, etc.

original: sa'i shtsushnu dag sha sha dag go //
analyzed: sa'i shtsushnu dag sha sha dag go //
translated: The earth, śa, śu, śu, śa.

original: tu'i tsu tu dag go //
analyzed: tu'i tsu tu dag go //
translated: The tu of tu, the two.

original: tshig mtha'i tu las ming ngang  na ba ti na ga ri: rnams min pa'i min no //
analyzed: tshig mtha'i tu las ming ngang  na ba ti na ga ri: rnams min pa'i min no //
translated: The tu at the end of a word is not a name, but not in nagarī.

original: tu'i sha la'o //
analyzed: tu'i sha la'o //
translated: The śa of tu, śa.

original: sha las so //
analyzed: sha las so //
translated: From śa.

original: yar gyi nyam la nyam yang na'o //
analyzed: yar gyi nyam la nyam yang na'o //
translated: The ya of the first class, ya, also na.

original: aa tsa las ra ha la gnyis so //🔽aatsa las pa la'o //
analyzed: aa tsa las ra ha la gnyis so // aatsa las pa la'o //
translated: The a of a, cala, the two, ra, ha.🔽The a of a, cala, pa.

original: yan las ma yi'i ste /
analyzed: yan las ma yi'i ste /
translated: The ya of ya, ma.

original: ta tas ta'i'ang ngo //
analyzed: ta tas ta'i'ang ngo //
translated: The ta of ta, ti.

original: shar las kha ya'i'o //
analyzed: shar las kha ya'i'o //
translated: The śa of śa, kha, ya.

original: khros tshig la bu tra'i a'a d'i na pu tra sogs las ma yin no //
analyzed: khros tshig la bu tra'i a'a d'i na pu tra sogs las ma yin no //
translated: In an angry statement, the a of putra, etc. is not putra.

original: @191a * // ra las aatsala shar gyi'o //
analyzed: @191a * // ra las aatsala shar gyi'o //
translated: The ra of ra, cala, śa.

original: ring po las so //
analyzed: ring po las so //
translated: From the long.

original: khar la dzhal gyi tsa ra ro //
analyzed: khar la dzhal gyi tsa ra ro //
translated: The ca of kara, jhala, ca.

original: mtha' la yang na'o //
analyzed: mtha' la yang na'o //
translated: At the end, also na.

original: aan gyi mtshams sbyor la rjes su sna ldan no //
analyzed: aan gyi mtshams sbyor la rjes su sna ldan no //
translated: The anusvāra of aṅ, the following, with a nose.

original: ya pa le 'dra yig rjes su nga ro'o //
analyzed: ya pa le 'dra yig rjes su nga ro'o //
translated: The ya of yāpala, the following, with a sound like ṅ.

original: sde pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: sde pa rnams la'o //
translated: The classes.

original: tshig mtha' min pa'i 'o //🔽tu'i la la'o //
analyzed: tshig mtha' min pa'i 'o // tu'i la la'o //
translated: Not at the end of a word.🔽The la of tu, la.

original: auta las sth'a stam bha dag gi ta'o //
analyzed: auta las sth'a stam bha dag gi ta'o //
translated: The ta of uta, the two, sthā, stha, mba.

original: skanda nad la'o //🔽hal las dznyar la dzhar rnams kyi 'dra yig la dbyi ba yang na'o //
analyzed: skanda nad la'o // hal las dznyar la dzhar rnams kyi 'dra yig la dbyi ba yang na'o //
translated: The letter ka is for the disease of leprosy.🔽The letter ya is for the letters la, ja, and jha.

original: dzha ya las ha'i snga ma 'dra yig go //
analyzed: dzha ya las ha'i snga ma 'dra yig go //
translated: The letter ha is for the letter ha.

original: aam la sha'i tsha'o //
analyzed: aam la sha'i tsha'o //
translated: The letter aṃ is for the letter ṣa.

original: shar la ci ya'i gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: shar la ci ya'i gnyis pa'o //
translated: The letter śa is for the two letters ci and yi.

original: rnam par ma chad pa brjod pa ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par ma chad pa brjod pa ldan pa'o //
translated: The letter sa is for the letter sa.

original: zhes pa s'a dhu k'irtti'i 'jam dpal gyi sgra brda sprod pa las skabs brgyad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: zhes pa s'a dhu k'irtti'i 'jam dpal gyi sgra brda sprod pa las skabs brgyad pa rdzogs so /
translated: This concludes the eighth chapter of the grammar of Mañjuśrī, the Sādhu Kirti.

original: // / sgra yi lo ma'i rgya mtsho'i 'gram du gnas pa'i ljon shing kun tu bskrun pa 'di //
analyzed: // / sgra yi lo ma'i rgya mtsho'i 'gram du gnas pa'i ljon shing kun tu bskrun pa 'di //
translated: This tree, planted on the shore of the ocean of grammar,

original: bstan bcos bdag nyid dpag med rigs pa'i rin chen tshogs kyis rtsa ba brtan par bcings //
analyzed: bstan bcos bdag nyid dpag med rigs pa'i rin chen tshogs kyis rtsa ba brtan par bcings //
translated: is firmly rooted with a collection of precious reasonings of the treatise.

original: sngon chad 'khrul par byas shing rmongs par phal cher bgrod dkar gyur la rkang brten te //
analyzed: sngon chad 'khrul par byas shing rmongs par phal cher bgrod dkar gyur la rkang brten te //
translated: Having previously erred and mostly gone astray in confusion, it is supported by the feet.

original: rtogs pa don gnyer 'jig rten deng nas grib bsil 'di la ngal bso bsten par gyis //
analyzed: rtogs pa don gnyer 'jig rten deng nas grib bsil 'di la ngal bso bsten par gyis //
translated: Now, worldly beings who seek understanding should rely on this shade for rest.

original: gzhung ni brgya phrag bdun rnams kyi //
analyzed: gzhung ni brgya phrag bdun rnams kyi //
translated: The treatise has seven hundred chapters.

original: yi ge mdzes par bkod pa nyid //
analyzed: yi ge mdzes par bkod pa nyid //
translated: And the letters are arranged beautifully.

original: 'dir ni 'don pa bzang ba yis //
analyzed: 'dir ni 'don pa bzang ba yis //
translated: Here, with an excellent recitation,

original: nyon mongs cha yang yang ma yin //🔽dpal ldan 'jam dpal dbyangs kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i mkhas pa chen po //
analyzed: nyon mongs cha yang yang ma yin // dpal ldan 'jam dpal dbyangs kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i mkhas pa chen po //
translated: The afflictions are not increased.🔽This is the complete text of the Mañjuśrī Vyākaraṇa,🔽composed by the great scholar🔽blessed by the glorious Mañjughoṣa,

original: slob dpon dge slong legs par grags pa'i zhal snga nas bkod pa 'jam dpal gyi brda sprod pa'i mdo yongs su rdzogs so /🔽// /'di ni rgyal dbang sprul pa'i sku //
analyzed: slob dpon dge slong legs par grags pa'i zhal snga nas bkod pa 'jam dpal gyi brda sprod pa'i mdo yongs su rdzogs so / // /'di ni rgyal dbang sprul pa'i sku //
translated: the master, the monk, the venerable Yaśomitra.🔽This was composed by the all-knowing

original: spyan snga thams cad mkhyen pa yi //🔽bka' dang dge slong lo ts'a ba //
analyzed: spyan snga thams cad mkhyen pa yi // bka' dang dge slong lo ts'a ba //
translated: in the presence of the king, the emanation body,🔽at the urging of the glorious Yaśodhara,

original: dpal ldan grags pas bskul ba bzhin //🔽lo ts'a'i ming 'dzin zhva lu ba //
analyzed: dpal ldan grags pas bskul ba bzhin // lo ts'a'i ming 'dzin zhva lu ba //
translated: the monk and translator.🔽The monk Dharmapāla,

original: dge slong dharma p'a la yis //🔽'di yi 'grel dang tsandra yi //
analyzed: dge slong dharma p'a la yis // 'di yi 'grel dang tsandra yi //
translated: a Śavara bearing the name of a translator,🔽having consulted the commentary on this🔽and the text of Candra,

original: gzhung la gtugs nas legs par bsgyur //
analyzed: gzhung la gtugs nas legs par bsgyur //
translated: has translated it well.

original: nongs pa mchis gang mkhas pa yi //
analyzed: nongs pa mchis gang mkhas pa yi //
translated: Whatever errors there are,

original: tshogs kyis bzod cing bcos par gsol /
analyzed: tshogs kyis bzod cing bcos par gsol /
translated: I request the assembly of scholars to bear with and correct them.
